title: Hindsight bias and tend and befriend - application

content.description: In his psychology class, Keenan was learning about the various ways people respond to and cope with stressful life events. While he believed that both men and women dealt with stress in the same way, his teacher explained that women are much more likely than men to reach out to friends to both give and receive support. Upon learning this, Keenan told a classmate this finding was totally predictable and obvious because women are typically more nurturing than men.
content.question: Keenanâ€™s thinking is most clearly an example of which of the following concepts?

skill.text: 1.B: Explain how cultural norms, expectations, and circumstances, as well as cognitive biases apply to behavior and mental processes.
